page.title: 03LANDSCAPE OF NORTHWOLD
page.content: Northwold is a conservation village and this has had a major influence on the current style of the village.It is a linear village. A large number of houses incorporate chalk and flint walls - the chalk coming from the pits which used to be at the west end of the village. Houses dating back to the mid 16th century nestle amongst later buildings.Very few houses have escaped being extended and modernised over the years.All external improvements to older properties should retain the character of the village. Many premises like bakeries,public houses and shops have been converted into domestic residences. A very old stone pillar is situated near the center of the village.Its origins are unknown.There is also a memorial cross near the church.
